properties.description: “A Victoria’s Secret in Texas banned a woman from breastfeeding her son in the lingerie store. Apparently they don’t want anyone to get the wrong impression of what breasts are for.”
properties.title: Victoria's Secret || Texas

properties.description: "A Montana man who was wearing a hat with the  word 'Weed' on it, was arrested after police found 6 pound of marijuana in his car. Police knew where to look for the drugs because his shirts said 'It's In The Trunk' "
properties.title: Man || Montana

properties.description: “Oreo this week introduced two new flavors: cookie dough and marshmallow crispy. It’s part of a new effort by Oreo to market to women having a hard time right now.”
properties.title: Oreo || Illinois

properties.description: “A Florida man was arrested after he went into a convenience store and tried to trade a live alligator for a 12 pack of beer. His bail has been set at 4 alligators.”
properties.title: Man || Florida

properties.description: “An 11 year-old Ohio boy was arrested after he punched his grandmother in a store when she refused to buy him a toy. So it sounds like they BOTH learned a valuable lesson.”
properties.title: Boy || Ohio

properties.description: “A Kentucky man set a new world record when he ate 15 Indian ghost peppers, which are 400 times hotter than a jalapeno. When reached for comment, the man said, ‘Somebody’s in here!’”
properties.title: Man || Kentucky

properties.description: “The Denver Post this week announce that they’re looking for a marijuana editor for their website. They have one. They’re just looking for him.”
properties.title: Denver Post || Colorado

properties.description: “A new restaurant has opened in New York City called Maid Café, in which the waitresses dress up as French maids and call diners “Master”. Maid Café is the first restaurant to be created for the sole purpose of inspiring an episode of SVU.”
properties.title: Maid Cafe || New York
